docblock.description: This file is part of Aura for PHP.
Parses command line input for named option and numeric argument values.
Any parsing errors.
The command line input to be parsed.
Use these option definitions when parsing input.
The values parsed from the command line input.
A factory to create option objects.
Constructor.
Sets the options to be used when parsing input.
Parses the input array according to the defined options.

tag.name: return
tag.description: False if there were parsing errors, true if there were no errors.

docblock.description: Gets a single option definition converted to an array.
docblock.long-description: Looking for an undefined option will cause an error message, but will otherwise proceed. Undefined short flags are treated as rejecting a param, and undefined long options are treated as taking an optional param.

docblock.description: Gets an option by its alias.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the matching option struct, or null if no option was found with that alias.

docblock.description: Sets the value for a long option.
Splits the long option input into name and value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the long option name and value.

docblock.description: Does the long option require a param value?
Does the long option reject a param value?
Parses a short option or cluster of short options.
Does the short option reject a value?
Does the short option capture the next input element as a value?
Does the short option require the next input element to be a value?
Parses a cluster of short options.
Sets an option value, adding to a value array for multi-values.
Adds to an array of multi-values for the option.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to add to the array of multi-values.

docblock.description: Sets the single value for an option.
Returns the defined options.
Returns the parsed values of named options and sequential arguments.
Returns the parsing errors.

Gets the single-line summary.

Sets the long-form description.

This file is part of Aura for PHP.
Constants for preferred exit status codes; cf.
Success
Failure
The command was used incorrectly, e.g., with the wrong number of arguments, a bad flag, a bad syntax in a parameter, or whatever.
The input data was incorrect in some way. This should only be used for users data and not system files.
An input file (not a system file) did not exist or was not readable.
docblock.long-description: This could also include errors like "No message" to a mailer (if it cared to catch it).

docblock.description: The user specified did not exist. This might be used for mail addresses or remote logins.
The host specified did not exist. This is used in mail addresses or network requests.

A service is unavailable. This can occur if a support program or file does not exist. This can also be used as a catchall message when something you wanted to do does not work, but you do not know why.
An internal software error has been detected. This should be limited to non-operating system related errors as possible.

An operating system error has been detected. This is intended to be used for such things as "cannot fork", "cannot create pipe", or the like. It includes things like getuid returning a user that does not exist in the passwd file.
Some system file (e.g., /etc/passwd, /var/run/utmp, etc.) does not exist, cannot be opened, or has some sort of error (e.g., syntax error).
A (user specified) output file cannot be created.
An error occurred while doing I/O on some file.
Temporary failure, indicating something that is not really an error.
docblock.long-description: In sendmail, this means that a mailer (e.g.) could not create a connection, and the request should be reattempted later.

docblock.description: The remote system returned something that was "not possible" during a protocol exchange.
You did not have sufficient permission to perform the operation. This is not intended for file system problems, which should use NOINPUT or CANTCREAT, but rather for higher level permissions.
Something was found in an unconfigured or misconfigured state.
This file is part of Aura for PHP.
Converts <<markup>> to VT100 display control codes for POSIX, or strips the <<markup>> entirely for non-POSIX.
Array of <<markup>> names to control code numbers.
docblock.long-description: Based on the `ANSI/VT100 Terminal Control reference` at <http://www.termsys.demon.co.uk/vtansi.htm>.

docblock.description: A regex for fomatting codes.
Constructor.
Converts <<markup>> in text to VT100 control codes for POSIX, or strips them for non-POSIX.
The callback to format <<markup>> for POSIX.
This file is part of Aura for PHP.
An object-oriented wrapper for file/stream resources.
The resource represented by the handle.
The resource name, typically a file or stream name.
The mode under which the resource was opened.
What is the current OS? (Used for POSIX checks.)
Is this a POSIX terminal?
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The resource to open, typically a PHP stream like "php://stdout".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Open the resource in this mode; e.g., "w+".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Force this PHP OS value; generally for testing.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Force this POSIX flag; generally for testing.

docblock.description: Sets `$php_os`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The operating system; if empty, uses the value of the PHP_OS constant.

docblock.description: Sets `$posix`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If boolean, forces the $posix value; otherwise, checks the $php_os value and posix_isatty() to auto-determine the value.

docblock.description: Destructor; closes the resource if it is not already closed.
Returns the resource name.
Returns the resource mode.
Reads 8192 bytes from the resource.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string read on success, or boolean false on failure.

docblock.description: Writes a string to the resource.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of bytes written on success, or boolean false on failure.

docblock.description: Rewinds the resource pointer.
Reads a line from the resource.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The line on success, or boolean false on failure.

docblock.description: Does the resource represent an interactive terminal?
